intro: Flagellaria philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine flagellaria, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
